properties.name: 24-hour Safeway - Downtown
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola1030 Sw Jefferson St, Portland, ORPretty swanky, considering the characters who reside in the nearby Park blocks. Right on the Streetcar line, complete with security guards for your safety! Hooray!

properties.name: 24-hour Safeway - SE
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola3930 Se Powell Blvd, Portland, ORAdd a new dimension to late nite grocery shopping- tweakers!

properties.name: 24-hour Walgreen's- Inner SE
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola940 Se 39th Ave, Portland, ORFor when you need false eyelashes at one in the morning, or you just want cookie dough and are too stoned to walk to Safeway-- Walgreen\'s is there for you.

properties.name: Original Hot Cake and Steak House
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola1002 SE Powell Blvd Portland, OR 97202-2534Another post-last call hotspot, only this one has a cop stationed by the door. One of the last spots on the planet with no sense of irony, from the bright yellow decor to the 80s power metal on the jukebox.

properties.name: The Roxy
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola1121 Southwest Stark Street, Portland, OR, 97205The food is awful, the bathrooms are filthy, and an assortment of heroin addicts congregate near the entrance, but there\'s just no avoiding The Roxy. Why? Because it\'s open. And on the plus side- the staff is less surly these days, and it\'s still a great place to watch all the strange people who flood the streets after last call, and occasionally catch a boy in full drag.

properties.name: black cats.
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola18th Street and Dolores Street, San Francisco, CAmy last day in san francisco, we walked for fourteen hours straight. the next day my feet were bruised from my new shoes that i bought in the mission. after traversing the city in the most illogical pattern, we ended our night at one in the morning in dolores park with a bottle of gato negro.

properties.name: everybody's got some(where) to hide.
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola SW 4th & SW Ankeny Street, Portland, OR"the alcove" appears to be the side of a hotel parking garage, and a hotel that doesn\'t get much traffic at that. while we rarely go west, we need a place to drink beer in public when we do.

properties.name: kill the living, raise the dead.
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola407 E 16th Avenue, Spokane, WAthe best two days of january 2006 were the two days i spent in spokane. i met all of laine\'s friends in full on zombie regalia at a birthday party full of street punks. way to make a first impression.

properties.name: merrily we roll along.
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola  new neighborhood, new adventures. summer in the city can be slooooooooowwwww, leaving three bored kids with nothing better to do than drink some tall cans and roll down the steep hill at brooklyn park at two in the morning. then again, i suppose we could have talked to the guy who was searching in the grass for marijuana.

properties.name: night swimming.
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola  705 N. Killingsworth St, Portland, ORat the pcc cascade campus, there is a swimming pool that is very easy to break into- just a quick climb over a very tall fence, but very doable. after a night of criss-crossing all over the city (secret house show, deserted warehouse party with free high life, tamales at javier\'s on lombard), we ended with some good old fashioned trespassing. i climbed the gate in high heels and swam in my underwear. we had been in the water for about ten minutes when the police rolled up. luckily, in north portland, the police have other things to worry about. however, slightly tipsy, we were convinced we had to run, and i fell about ten feet onto the street in the process. my leg was twitching for days afterwards.

properties.name: shocking.
properties.description: Posted by Ohlola8900 N Vancouver Ave, Portland, ORanytime we\'re bored on a weeknight, one of us is bound to suggest "beer picnic at MLK Fashion Plaza!" its parking lot was once the site of the culmination of an evening spent careening about north portland in a sketchy van with out of state plates, drinking iron city, making sacramento treats with a forty we found in a bus shelter in front of a lesbian bar (why were we carrying lemons again?) and waving a foam shocker hand (see website) lewdly at trucks from beneath the the paul bunyan statue on interstate avenue. by the time security arrived, we had already evaded the law once, and i attempted to feign sobriety by conversing with the guard about his very large flashlight. according to him, "they can see what we\'re doing, you know."

properties.name: train kept a-rolling
properties.description: Posted by OhlolaPortland, ORwe drank cheap wine for dinner, and famished three hours later, embarked on a midnight bus ride to montage. i stashed a six pack of pbr in my bag, which we finished off while lost under the morrison bridge on water avenue. we sat on the curb and watched the train roll, slow and clumsy, for almost fifteen minutes. it was april, cold and rainy. i didn\'t care.

properties.name: train kept a-rolling (almost).
properties.description: Posted by OhlolaPortland, ORafter a fiasco involving a gutter punk bridge guide; a misunderstanding about free beer and IDs; a forty year old bouncer named Dawn who wore really hideous jeans and cowboy boots; and an impromptu trip to the burger king drive thru our posse decided to once again watch the train roll past. only this time there was, for some reason, some drunk woman and her car stuck on the train tracks. the train barely stopped, and as we helped push the car off the tracks, an SUV full of coked-up strippers rolled up and started climbing on the train. what?
